results.title: Metformin reduces insulin resistance and attenuates progressive renal injury in prepubertal obese Dahl salt-sensitive rats.
results.text_hl: @<m>DISEASE_Renal_Tubular_Transport_Inborn_Errors</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015499 @@@Glomerular and tubular injury@@@ and @DISEASE_Inflammation @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@renal inflammation@@@ and @DISEASE_Fibrosis @DISEASE_MESH:D005355 @@@fibrosis@@@ were significantly higher in vehicle-treated SSLepRmutant rats versus SS rats, and @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ reduced these parameters in SSLepRmutant rats.

citations.NLM: Ekperikpe US, Mandal S, Holt SJ, Daniels JK, Johnson TD, Cooper JS, Safir SM, Cornelius DC, Williams JM. Metformin reduces insulin resistance and attenuates progressive renal injury in prepubertal obese Dahl salt-sensitive rats. Am J Physiol Renal Physiol. 2023 Jul 27;():. PMID: 37498548
citations.BibTeX: @article{37498548, title={Metformin reduces insulin resistance and attenuates progressive renal injury in prepubertal obese Dahl salt-sensitive rats.}, author={Ekperikpe US and Mandal S and Holt SJ and Daniels JK and Johnson TD and Cooper JS and Safir SM and Cornelius DC and Williams JM}, journal={Am J Physiol Renal Physiol}}

results.title: Synergistic modulation of endoplasmic reticulum stress pathway, oxidative DNA damage and apoptosis by beta-amyrin and metformin in mitigating hyperglycemia-induced renal damage using adult zebrafish model.
results.text_hl: Histopathological analysis showed improved renal architecture with significantly lower (p <= 0.05) @<m>DISEASE_Renal_Tubular_Transport_Inborn_Errors</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015499 @@@renal tubular injury@@@ scores with the combination than with individual treatment.

citations.NLM: Roohi TF, Krishna KL, Shakeel F. Synergistic modulation of endoplasmic reticulum stress pathway, oxidative DNA damage and apoptosis by beta-amyrin and metformin in mitigating hyperglycemia-induced renal damage using adult zebrafish model. BMC Pharmacol Toxicol. 2024 Sep 27;25(1):66. PMID: 39334288
citations.BibTeX: @article{39334288, title={Synergistic modulation of endoplasmic reticulum stress pathway, oxidative DNA damage and apoptosis by beta-amyrin and metformin in mitigating hyperglycemia-induced renal damage using adult zebrafish model.}, author={Roohi TF and Krishna KL and Shakeel F}, journal={BMC Pharmacol Toxicol}, volume={25}, number={1}, pages={66}}

results.title: AMPK alleviates high uric acid-induced Na+-K+-ATPase signaling impairment and cell injury in renal tubules
results.text_hl: Although @GENE_PRKAA2 @GENE_78975 @@@AMPK@@@ activation by @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ did not reduce serum UA levels in @DISEASE_Juvenile_gout @DISEASE_MESH:C537696 @@@hyperuricemic@@@ @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@, it significantly alleviated @DISEASE_Hyperuricemia @DISEASE_MESH:D033461 @@@HUA@@@-induced @<m>DISEASE_Renal_Tubular_Transport_Inborn_Errors</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015499 @@@renal tubular injury@@@ and @GENE_TAC1 @GENE_6863 @@@NKA@@@ signaling impairment in vivo with effects similar to those of @CHEMICAL_Febuxostat @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000069465 @@@febuxostat@@@.

citations.NLM: Xiao J, Zhu S, Guan H, Zheng Y, Li F, Zhang X, Guo H, Wang X, Ye Z. AMPK alleviates high uric acid-induced Na+-K+-ATPase signaling impairment and cell injury in renal tubules Exp Mol Med. 2019 May 22;51(5):1-14. PMID: 31118410
citations.BibTeX: @article{31118410, title={AMPK alleviates high uric acid-induced Na+-K+-ATPase signaling impairment and cell injury in renal tubules}, author={Xiao J and Zhu S and Guan H and Zheng Y and Li F and Zhang X and Guo H and Wang X and Ye Z}, journal={Exp Mol Med}, volume={51}, number={5}, pages={1-14}}
